note.p: Death: Lord Lansdowne's seat, Lymington, Hampshire (29 July 1795)

Career: Wrote "Experiments and observations on animal heat and the inflammation of combustible bodies" (London, 1779); Physician, St Thomas' Hospital, London (1783-1795); Professor of Chemistry, Woolwich
References: Douglas McKie, 'Priestley's Laboratory and Library and Other of his Effects' in NR 1956-57 vol 12 pp 114-136
